module.name: CalcForm
module.short: Contains classes and types used in TCalculatorForm.

descr.p: calcform.pas contains classes and types used in TCalculatorForm, a dialog form used to display a calculator. It is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: CalcDefPrecision
element.short: Defines the default number of digits of precision used for values in TCalculatorForm.

element.name: TCalculatorCalcKeyEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled for Key events occurring in TCalculatorForm.

element.name: TCalculatorCalcKeyEvent.Key
element.short: Key value examined in the event handler.

element.name: TCalculatorDispChangeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when the display in TCalculatorForm is changed.

descr.p: TCalculatorState is an enumerated type with values that represent the status for keys/operations in the calculator. TCalculatorState is the type used to implement the Status property in TCalculatorPanel.

element.name: TCalculatorState.csFirst
element.short: Value on the First key press.

element.name: TCalculatorState.csValid
element.short: Value after the operation for the key has been applied successfully.

element.name: TCalculatorState.csError
element.short: Value when the operation resulted in an error.

descr.p: TCalculatorLayout is an enumerated type with values that represent the layout for keys and panels on a calculator form. TCalculatorLayout is passed as an argument to the CreateCalculatorForm routine, and to methods in TCalculatorForm and TCalculatorPanel.

element.name: TCalculatorLayout.clNormal
element.short: The default layout with larger button sizes and more whitespace.

element.name: TCalculatorLayout.clSimple
element.short: The compact layout with smaller button sizes.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel
element.short: Implements a panel used for buttons and the value display in a calculator form.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.SetCalcText
element.short: Sets the value for the text property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.SetCalcText.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CheckFirst
element.short: Ensures that Text is updated and displayed when Status is csFirst.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKey
element.short: Performs actions for a key press not handled by a button in the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Clear
element.short: Clears the display and operator in the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Error
element.short: Updates the calculator panel to reflect an error condition, and signals OnError.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.SetDisplay
element.short: Sets the Text in the calculator panel to the specified value, and signals OnDisplayChange.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.SetDisplay.R
element.short: Double value formatted and assigned to the Text property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.GetDisplay
element.short: Gets the Double value represented in the Text property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.FindButton
element.short: Finds the calculator button which handles the specified key character.

descr.p: Key contains a character value to locate in the button captions on the panel. Keys which are not represented by buttons, like Enter (#13) and Escape (#27), are translated to the value used for the target button. In addition, when ',' is used as the decimal separator on the system, it is translated into the '.' decimal notation.
FindButton iterates through the Controls on the panel to locate the button using the associated Key. The return value is Nil when a button is not located for the value in Key.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.FindButton.Result
element.short: Button which handles the Key, or Nil when no button is available for Key.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.FindButton.Key
element.short: Key character to locate in the buttons for the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.BtnClick
element.short: Translates a mouse click on a button to the character key used in CalcKey.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.BtnClick.Sender
element.short: Calculator button for the button click notification.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.ErrorBeep
element.descr: ErrorBeep is an empty implementation in the current LCL version.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.TextChange
element.short: Sets the display text for the associated control and signals OnTextChange.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CreateLayout
element.short: Initializes and configures the calculator panel using the specified layout.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKeyPress
element.short: Locates the button using the specified Key and perform its Click method.
element.descr: CalcKey is called when a button is located using the specified Key.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKeyPress.Sender
element.short: Object for the KeyPress event.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKeyPress.Key

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Copy
element.short: Loads the value in Text into the Clipboard as a text value.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Paste
element.short: Pastes text from the Clipboard into the text display for the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.WorkingPrecision
element.short: Gets the minimum number of precision digits allowable for the panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.UpdateMemoryLabel
element.short: Updates the Memory indicator to reflect a non-zero value in the Memory property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.DisplayValue

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Memory
element.short: Contains the Double value stored in the memory for the calculator.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Precision

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.BeepOnError
element.short: Indicates if a beep occurs when an error condition is detected in the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Status
element.short: Contains the status or state for the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OperatorChar
element.short: Character representing the last operator entered in the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Text
element.short: Text representation for the Double value in the calculator.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Color
